intro: Stephanotis chunii, commonly known as the Chinese jasmine or evergreen stephanotis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, fleshy berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its pleasant fragrance and attractive appearance. Stephanotis chunii thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
